tweet: Singhvi: That is conspicuous by the entire FIR. We are talking not of apples and oranges but it's the same sec. 3 and 7 of the Essential Commodities Act.
name: Live Law

tweet: Unless an order is passed expressly regulating a commodity under Section 3(1) for objectives under Section 3(2) of the Essential Commodities Act, even if a commodity is an essential commodity, it would not lead to criminality: Dr Singhvi in Navneet Kalra case.
name: Apoorva Mandhani

tweet: If drugs are devises and they are to included in the DPCO which is covered under Essential Commodities act, would oxygen concentrators not come under the Essential commodities Act : Court   #NavneetKalra
name: Bar & Bench

tweet: By a notification, devices have been notified as drugs.  Drugs are controlled by the Drug (Price Control) Order 2013. Essential Commodities Act schedule includes drugs.  Would it not then lead to a conclusion that an oxygen concentrator is an essential commodity? Court asks.
name: Apoorva Mandhani

tweet: Kalra's lawyer, Dr Abhishek Manu Singhvi is arguing that such an office memorandum wouldn't amount to a notification under the Essential Commodities Act.  But the court is pointing out that it does say that MRP of medical devices cannot be increased more than 10% in a year.
name: Apoorva Mandhani

tweet: Senior Advocate Abhishek Manu Singhvi arguing on behalf Navneet Kalra in Delhi HC, taking the court through the Essential Commodities Act, says, 'There is nothing of that sort. It requires you to designate a list of items but not every item regulated'  https://t.co/RZHKU3wOei
name: Republic

tweet: Court: Where is the notification of March 31, 2020 under Drugs Price Control Order. When this order read with Essential Commodities Act, it states that the prices have to be regulated. I understand this is just to ensure that MRP has to be laid down.
name: Live Law

tweet: Singhvi now refers to various provisions of the Essential Commodities Act.  #DelhiCovid #COVID19 #NavneetKalra #OxygenConcentrator
name: Live Law

tweet: Singhvi referring to sec. 3 of the Essential Commodities Act.  "The Act has a dual system. One part requires you to designate list of items which are essential. But it's a misconceived notion that all such items are regulated." Singhvi argues.
name: Live Law

tweet: There is nothing of that sort : Singhvi as it takes the court through Essential Commodities act (EC Act).   It requires you to designate a list of items but not every item is regulated: Singhvi
name: Bar & Bench

tweet: I'm selling oxygen concentrators under invoices with GST payment.. openly, to help.. I have done no hoarding. There is no order under Essential commodities Act: Singhvi  #NavneetKalra
name: Bar & Bench

tweet: Singhvi:  I have recently done a business of buying oxygen Concentrators with GST payment. But more than that, openly, to help people I know and not necessarily for free. I have done no hoarding. There is no order under sec. 3 of the Essential Commodities Act.
